p: Read this postcard from your English pen-friend, Sam.

p._:
"Ours is a small town. There are nice trees and some old buildings. Does it really
			matter where I go in the evenings?"

Here is a postcard of my town. Please send me a postcard from your
					town. What size is your town? What is the nicest part of your town?
					Where do you go in the evenings? Sam.

blockquote.p: "It is a triangle with three equal sides."

qti-feedback-inline._:
No,
                an isosceles triangle has only two sides equal; if all three sides are equal we say
                it is an equilateral triangle.

The angles are also equal, but it is called an equilateral
                triangle.

It
                is a special sort of triangle, called an equilateral triangle.
That's right, an octahedron has 8 faces.
